docs.lead_paragraph: The case of a young woman with a high-risk pregnancy who is awaiting a Salvadoran Supreme Court ruling has become a focal point in a broad battle over abortion in Latin America.

headline.seo: Pregnant, Sick and Pressing Salvadoran Abortion Law
headline.main: A Salvadoran at Risk Tests Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: A Salvadoran At Risk Tests Abortion Law

docs.abstract: Case of young woman with high-risk pregnancy who is awaiting a Salvadoran Supreme Court ruling has become a focal point over abortion in Latin America; case tests whether abortion should remain off limits even when mother is at risk and baby has little hope of survival; several Latin American nations have softened their stances on issue but in El Salvador, abortion is illegal under any circumstances.
docs.snippet: The case of a young woman with a high-risk pregnancy who is awaiting a Salvadoran Supreme Court ruling has become a focal point in a broad battle over abortion in Latin America.

byline.contributor: Gene Palumbo contributed reporting from San Salvador.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some students are rebelling against a system they compare to “a factory that manufactures identical people,” and they have an ally in the education minister.

headline.seo: Thai Students Find Government Ally in Push to Relax School Regimentation
headline.main: In Thailand’s Schools, Vestiges of Military Rule
headline.print_headline: Thai Students Push to Ease Rules

docs.abstract: Some students in Thailand are challenging nation's regimented school system as legacy of military rule fades; students have receptive allies in forward-thinking education minister Phongthep Thepkanjana and in government that is seeking to reduce military's role in civic life.
docs.snippet: Some students are rebelling against a system they compare to “a factory that manufactures identical people,” and they have an ally in the education minister.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok and Samut Prakan.

docs.lead_paragraph: One hospital tends to dozens of communities in a remote Alaskan region the size of Oregon, where medical decisions are filtered through an equation of time and distance.

headline.seo: Health Care in Vast Alaska Frontier Is Spread Thin
headline.main: Health Care Is Spread Thin on Alaskan Frontier
headline.print_headline: Health Care Is Spread Thin on Alaskan Frontier

docs.abstract: Yukon-Kuskokwim Health Corporation, lone hospital in Alaska's remote western region, struggles to provide care for mostly native population of 28,000 that is spread out across area size of Oregon; chief of staff Dr Ellen Hodges faces extremely difficult triage decisions daily, deploying limited air transport in harsh conditions to communities that have no access to roads.
docs.snippet: One hospital tends to dozens of communities in a remote Alaskan region the size of Oregon, where medical decisions are filtered through an equation of time and distance.
